summary: This is an FBI 302 interview report of a witness (referred to as 'Victim-3') conducted on October 23, 2019. The witness describes meeting Jeffrey Epstein through a recruiter, performing massages at his New York townhouse and on his private island, and details of the abusive encounters and threats made by Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central figure accused of sexual abuse and coercion. The witness describes massaging him at his New York townhouse and on his private island, where he became rough and threatening.

persons.name: Victim-3
persons.context: The individual being interviewed. She describes being recruited for massage work for Epstein, traveling to his properties, and experiencing abusive and threatening behavior from him.

persons.context: Present for the witness interview at One Saint Andrews Plaza in New York.

connections.description: Victim-3 was recruited to provide massages to Epstein, which became abusive. Epstein threatened her career when she resisted.
Epstein told Victim-3 that he knew Halle Berry, name-dropping during massages.
Epstein told Victim-3 that he knew Cuba Gooding Jr., name-dropping during massages.

events.title: Victim-3 Moves to NYC
events.description: Victim-3 moved to New York City on the day of a blackout in August 2003.

events.title: FBI Interview of Victim-3
events.description: Victim-3 was interviewed by the FBI, AUSA, and a detective at One Saint Andrews Plaza in New York.

events.title: Trip to Epstein's Island
events.description: Victim-3 traveled to Epstein's private island via his plane and helicopter. She spent 2-3 days there with other young women, where Epstein arranged massages and became abusive.

events.title: Abusive Massage and Threat
events.description: During a massage, Epstein became rough and forceful. When Victim-3 resisted, he grew angry and threatened that she would not get modeling work in New York City, claiming he had influence with agency higher-ups.

locations: One Saint Andrews Plaza, New York, New York
Jeffrey Epstein's Upper East Side townhouse (77th street or similar)
keyFacts: The witness (Victim-3) was recruited by a blonde Russian woman to perform massages for Jeffrey Epstein, which were presented as easy money.
Victim-3 traveled to Epstein's private island via his private plane and helicopter, where she was among several other young women, one estimated to be around 17 years old.
During a massage, Epstein became rough and forceful. When Victim-3 became upset and resisted, Epstein threatened her modeling career, saying he had lunch with higher-ups in modeling agencies.
Epstein's New York townhouse had a dedicated massage room with oils, towels, and an envelope containing $300-$400 in cash left for the masseuse.
Epstein name-dropped celebrities Halle Berry and Cuba Gooding Jr. during massages and frequently talked about how he became wealthy.
